schemeValue.name: DTCC
schemeValue.paragraph: The Depository Trust and Clearing Corporation

scheme.name: contractualDefinitionsScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: Specifies a set of standard contract definitions relevant to the transaction

schemeValue.name: ISDA1998FX
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 1998 FX and Currency Option Definitions

scheme.name: contractualSupplementScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: Defines the supplements to a base set of ISDA Definitions that are applicable to the transaction.

schemeValue.name: ISDA1999CreditRestructuring
schemeValue.paragraph: Restructuring Supplement to the 1999 ISDA Credit Derivatives Definitions dated May 11, 2001.

schemeValue.name: ISDA1999CreditConvertibleExchangeableAccretingObligations
schemeValue.paragraph: Supplement to the 1999 ISDA Credit Derivatives Definitions Relating to Convertible, Exchangeable or Accreting Obligations dated November 9, 2001.

schemeValue.name: ISDA1999CreditSuccessorAndCreditEvents
schemeValue.paragraph: Supplement Relating to Successor and Credit Events to the 1999 ISDA Credit Derivatives Definitions dated November 28, 2001.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditMay2003
schemeValue.paragraph: May 2003 Supplement to the 2003 ISDA Credit Derivatives Definitions.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditMonolineInsurers
schemeValue.paragraph: Additional Provisions for Physically Settled Default Swaps Monoline Insurer as Reference Entity dated May 9, 2003.

scheme.name: cutNameScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: The specification of the cut name, or expiry date and time, for an FX OTC option.

scheme.name: contractualDefinitionsScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: Specifies a set of standard contract definitions relevant to the transaction

schemeValue.name: ISDA1998FX
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 1998 FX and Currency Option Definitions

schemeValue.name: Composite
schemeValue.paragraph: FX rate is based on a composite of observed rates.

schemeValue.name: Quanto
schemeValue.paragraph: FX rate is fixed at trade time.

scheme.name: governingLawScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: Identification of the law governing the transaction.

schemeValue.name: GBGY
schemeValue.paragraph: The law of the island of Guernsey

schemeValue.name: GBIM
schemeValue.paragraph: The law of the Isle of Man

schemeValue.name: GBJY
schemeValue.paragraph: The law of the island of Jersey

scheme.name: informationProviderScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: The specification of a list of information providers and vendors who publish financial markets information. Their information sources will typically be used to determine a relevant market rate, price or index.

schemeValue.name: FederalReserve
schemeValue.paragraph: The Federal Reserve, the central bank of the United States.

schemeValue.name: FHLBSF
schemeValue.paragraph: The Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, or its successor.

schemeValue.name: ISDA
schemeValue.paragraph: International Swaps and Derivatives Association, Inc.

schemeValue.name: SAFEX
schemeValue.paragraph: South African Futures Exchange, or its successor.

scheme.name: marketDisruptionScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: Defines the handling of a averaging date market disruption for an equity derivative transaction.

schemeValue.name: Omission
schemeValue.paragraph: As defined in section 6.7 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 2002 Equity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: Postponement
schemeValue.paragraph: As defined in section 6.7 para (c) subpara (ii) of the ISDA 2002 Equity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: ModifiedPostponement
schemeValue.paragraph: As defined in section 6.7 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 2002 Equity Derivative definitions.

scheme.name: masterAgreementTypeScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: Defines the type of the master agreement governing the transaction.

schemeValue.name: AFB
schemeValue.paragraph: AFB Master Agreement for Foreign Exchange and Derivatives Transactions

schemeValue.name: German
schemeValue.paragraph: German Master Agreement for Financial derivatives and Addendum for Options on Stock Exchange Indices or Securities

schemeValue.name: Swiss
schemeValue.paragraph: Swiss Master Agreement for OTC Derivatives Instruments

scheme.name: masterConfirmationTypeScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: Defines the type of master confirmation agreement governing the transaction.

schemeValue.name: ISDA1999Credit
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 1999 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditAsia
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Asia had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditAustraliaNewZealand
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Australia and New Zealand had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditEuropean
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if European had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditJapan
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Japan had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditNorthAmerican
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if North American had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditSingapore
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Singapore had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditSovereignAsia
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA Sovereign 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Asia had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditSovereignCentralAndEasternEurope
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA Sovereign 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Central and Eastern Europe had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditSovereignJapan
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA Sovereign 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Japan had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditSovereignLatinAmerica
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA Sovereign 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Latin America had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditSovereignMiddleEast
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA Sovereign 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Middle East had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ISDA2003CreditSovereignWesternEurope
schemeValue.paragraph: ISDA Sovereign 2003 Master Credit Derivatives Confirmation Agreement interpreted as if Western Europe had been specified as the relevant Transaction Type in the Transaction Supplement.

schemeValue.name: 2003CreditIndex
schemeValue.paragraph: Used for CDS Index trades. Relevant Master Confirmation determined by the contents of the creditDefaultSwap element.

scheme.name: restructuringScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: Specifies the form of the restructuring credit event that is applicable to the credit default swap.

schemeValue.name: R
schemeValue.paragraph: Restructuring as defined in the applicable ISDA Credit Derivatives Definitions. (1999 or 2003). Note that the 1999 Restructuring definition can be altered on a bilateral basis with the November 2001 Successor Supplement.

schemeValue.name: ModR
schemeValue.paragraph: 1999 Definitions: Restructuring definition and May 2001 Restructuring supplement apply.Note that the 1999 Restructuring definition can be altered on a bilateral basis with the November 2001 Successor Supplement. 2003 Definitions: Restructuring (Section 4.7) and Restructuring Maturity Limitation and Fully Transferable Obligation (Section 2.32) apply.

schemeValue.name: ModModR
schemeValue.paragraph: 2003 Definitions: Restructuring (Section 4.7) and Modified Restructuring Maturity Limitation and Conditionally Transferable Obligation (Section 2.33) apply.

scheme.name: routingIdCodeScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: The specification of the routing id code, which can be used to determine the coding convention for the settlement.

scheme.name: settlementMethodScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: The specification of the method for settling a particular trade.

schemeValue.name: Chaps
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via Chaps network.

schemeValue.name: ChipsABA
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via Chips ABA.

schemeValue.name: ChipsUID
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via Chips UID.

schemeValue.name: CLS
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via CLS Bank.

schemeValue.name: Fedwire
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via U.S. Fedwire.

schemeValue.name: SWIFT
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled via SWIFT network.

schemeValue.name: DDA
schemeValue.paragraph: To be settled over DDA account.

scheme.name: settlementPriceSourceScheme
scheme.schemeDefinition: The source from which the settlement price is to be obtained.

schemeValue.name: Bid
schemeValue.paragraph: The bid price per share on the exchange at the valuation time on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: Offer
schemeValue.paragraph: The offer price per share on the exchange at the valuation time on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: Mid
schemeValue.paragraph: The mid-market price per share on the exchange at the valuation time on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: NASDAQ
schemeValue.paragraph: An amount equal to the arithmetic average of the two prices constituting the Bid/Offer Spread. "Bid/Offer Spread" means the highest bid price per share and the corresponding lowest offer price per share last published prior to or at the expiration time on the expiration date.

schemeValue.name: OfficialClose
schemeValue.paragraph: (i) The published official closing price of the shares on the exchange on the valuation date, or (ii) the official closing level of the index, as published by the index sponsor, on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: OfficialSettlement
schemeValue.paragraph: The official settlement price (however described under the rules of the relevant exchange or its clearing house) on maturity of any of the relevant exchange-traded contracts published by the exchange or its clearing house. For this purpose, exchange-traded contract shall mean a future or listed option contract on the Index whose delivery date is expected to be on the valuation date

schemeValue.name: PrezzoDiRiferimento
schemeValue.paragraph: The official reference price per share quoted by the exchange on the exchange business day immediately prior to the expiration date equal to the weighted average of the last 10% traded volume on the share
